paragraphs.text: Try my new NHS helpline. You've nothing to lose but the will to live...
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: The NHS has had a pretty horrible Christmas, with A&Es; swamped, more than a dozen hospitals declaring major incidents and a bleak midwinter bed shortage worthy of first-century Bethlehem
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Various causes have been cited: not enough money, too many ill people, the government, the previous government and GPs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But a major contributory factor appears to be the NHS 111 helpline
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That's the number you're now supposed to ring if you don't need an ambulance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Not any time you don't need an ambulance, obviously
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Not, for example, when you need a fire engine or the police instead
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: - stick with 999 for those
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: It's for when you don't need an ambulance, a fire engine or the police but, if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you were pressed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you'd have to admit it's an ambulance that you don't need least
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you were to pick one of those things you don't need and try to make some sort of use of it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you'd go for the ambulance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On balance
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Because
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: come
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: to think of it
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you might actually need an ambulance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I absolutely can't think of a simpler way of describing it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It seems that NHS 111 works slightly differently from NHS Direct
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which preceded it and was staffed by nurses
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: in that very few of the people who answer the phone are medically trained
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They have no more chance of fixing a human body themselves than someone in an EE call centre has of generating a 3G signal using an alkaline battery and a radio transmitter
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They work off a computer system called Pathways
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which tells them what questions to ask and then, the answers having been typed in, what advice to give
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: As triage goes, this is flawed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The first stage of it - the decision to opt for 111 rather than, on the one hand, 999 or, on the other, a paracetamol and a lie-down- is conducted by the patients themselves
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This ensures that the new service gets a nice mix of those who are definitely dying but don't want to be any trouble and malingerers who are losing the courage of their convictions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Then the next stage is a sort of medical version of those magazine surveys that claim to tell you whether you're romantic or sociopathic or spiritual or a typical Scorpio
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: regardless of whether most of your answers are As, Bs or Cs, the system still just advises you to consult someone trained to diagnose whether there' s anything really wrong with you, rather than waste any more time describing your nasty rash to a guy whose last job was cold-calling about missold PPIs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that's what causes the trouble for A&E;: the combination of a risk-averse computer algorithm, call centre staff who don't want blood on their hands and the scarcity of GP appointments on public holidays, weekends and when there' s good skiing to be had, is driving thousands of 111 callers into A&E; to be put on a trolley and ignored like a rum baba in a 70s restaurant
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The solution is simple
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the algorithm needs some backbone
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: By which I don't mean that the decisions should be taken by actual live vertebrates- that's obviously unworkably expensive
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But we need to be honest with ourselves
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the whole point of this phone line is to fob people off
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: to stop them going to hospital, not encourage them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Deep down, they want to be told they're fine and to stop moaning - otherwise they would've dialled 999
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: so
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a new version of Pathways needs to be designed with that in mind
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Ring ring
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Click
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Recorded Voice
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: We're sorry that you too have found it necessary to call NHS 111
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: We apologise for the delay but we're experiencing extremely high call volume
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Hold music: Eye of the Tiger or Feeling Good
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: The music fades in between the following recorded messages
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: It's that time of year
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Colds, sniffles - nothing serious
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you know how people are
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Bloody hypochondriacs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Not saying that's you, of course
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I'm sure you're at death's door
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Just hope there' s no one with a burst appendix in the phone queue just behind you
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: that's all
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Wouldn't want you to have that on your conscience
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Still
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: nice music, eh?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Stirring stuff
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I expect you're feeling better already
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Calls may be recorded for subsequent publication as a book of hilarious and embarrassing medical anecdotes
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Your continuing to hold will be taken as consent for your name to be used
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Each caller will remain on hold for at least 10 minutes
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This will thin down the numbers considerably - for various reasons
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: When the call is finally answered
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the following questions will be asked
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Q  Thank you for calling NHS 111
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Please enter the last seven digits of your NHS number into your HealthSentry device sponsored by Nivea Visage, and read out the resultant 16-letter Medicode
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Q  How are you?
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: If answer is "Fine, thanks", even as a reflex, hang up immediately
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: It's worth a try
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Q
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Have you experienced your current symptoms before?
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: If answer is yes
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Well, they didn't kill you last time
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: If answer is no
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: And you didn't think you might give it a week and see if they clear up?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Q  How can you be sure that the way you feel now isn't how you're meant to feel and the way you used to feel wasn't an illness from which you've now recovered?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Q
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Are you aware that, in the vast majority of cases, there's nothing wrong with the patient
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: that won't clear up of its own accord?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Q
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Are you aware that, in a significant percentage of the remaining cases, there's no effective treatment
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: so
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's probably kinder to remain undiagnosed?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Q
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: You don't fancy giving homeopathy a try, do you?
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: It's very convenient, assuming you've got access to mains water
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Q
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Have you made a will?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If answer is no
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Don't you think that's a priority, instead of wasting time on the phone?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If answer is yes
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: It's not from one of those will kits, is it?
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Because
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they're about as likely to stand up in court as Oliver Reed after a heavy night
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I mean
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you might as well just bequeath everything to lawyers now
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No, you need a proper one, done by a solicitor
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It's an absolute priority to get that sorted before you let some junior doctor open you up and poke around
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Q  On a scale of 1 to 10
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: where
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: 1 means "strongly disagree"
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: and 10 means "strongly agree"
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: how would you respond to the phrase"We've all got to go some time"?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: David Mitchell's new book, Thinking About It Only Makes It Worse, is published by Guardian Faber (? 18.99)
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: To order a copy for ? 11.99 go to bookshop.theguardian.com or call 0330 333 6846
paragraphs.label: other
